Posts.Content: Hi Jo - have you only received AC chemo or have you had the other FEC-T? I am a stage 3 invasive breast cancer too. How is the chemo going, didn't you try the cold cap? Best wishes Louise x
Posts.Title: AC Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Jo snap having 4 sessions of AC too. I am going to try the cold cap but if I can't cope then my hairdresser has offered to shave my head after hours in the hairdressers. I got more from your blog and from this site than going to a breast care meeting at my local church hall which my BCN recommended to meet other ladies diagnosed with BC, I just didn't get any benefit from the meeting so thanks. Keep up the good chemo work Lou xx
Posts.Title: AC Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi everyone - I am due to start AC chemo next week and I was wondering what the difference was between AC and FEC-T as I have seen this posted when ladies are going through chemo - I currently have a cold so hoping this will be clear by Monday for when I have FBC taken to check blood levels ok. If anyone had any advice I would appreciate info. Many thanks Louise x

Posts.Content: This is encouraging fluff99 many thanks and special wishes it stays put! Louise x

Posts.Title: AC Chemo

Posts.Content: Yipeeee glad you are on the mend! Good luck for the job x
Posts.Title: THANKYOU SO MUCH

Posts.Content: Hiya Londonlass - it is good to admit you are struggling, I am also on a low ebe and cried most of the way to radiotherapy this morning, thinking of my situation and also thinking of you. It all gets too much sometimes! Hope all goes ok today x
Posts.Title: Have to be honest.....

Posts.Content: Hiya Londonlass - it is good to admit you are struggling, I am also on a low ebe and cried most of the way to radiotherapy this morning, thinking of my situation and also thinking of you. It all gets too much sometimes! Hope all goes ok today x
Posts.Title: Have to be honest.....

Posts.Content: Even though i have not met you......yet, I feel you are a dear friend. Help, advice and suggestions is something you are remarkable at....well done and keep it up. Will be thinking of you on Wednesday Lou xxx
Posts.Title: Have to be honest.....

Posts.Content: i appreciate your email - thank you. I asked the surgeon when I met him last Wednesday what the grade of my cancer was and he confirmed they found both grades 2 and 3 in the breast that was removed. At the oncologist appt on Friday she confirmed the lump was cut away from  the chest wall and that there would have been cancer cells left behind, so confirmed grade 3. I feel that the pathogist report was not discussed properly at the weekly meeting, otherwise the surgeon and BCN would not have said cancer free! I was ER+ also a chat with other dibetics would help. i have confirmed an appt for tomorrow pm to meet with surgeon, nurse and a different oncologist. x
Posts.Title: I don't know what to do

Posts.Content: I was informed by oncologist that chemo would probably not be good for me as it could risk sepsis?!? I have been diabetic for 30 years and type 1. I understand it takes diabetics slightly slower to heal and apparently we are more at risk from ulcers and chemo can cause ulcers. I see a renal consultant yearly to check my kidneys and I am on tablets (ramapril) to keep blood pressure at a good level but other than that I have no idea why I probably can't go ahead with chemo. I apologies if I have caused concern but you appreciate each case is different - I have an appointment tomorrow to discuss with another oncologist and my surgeon. I have also been told by oncologist that ER+ BC chemo isn't that affective??
Posts.Title: I don't know what to do

Posts.Title: I don't know what to do

Posts.Content: thank you for your email this was very encouraging. I will discuss at my appt tomorrow. I think the oncolgist means that should I become septic it would be harder for me to recover from. I did not know about the white count boosters. I agree re the nodes and that I would benefit from chemo. I am being offered tamoxifen, radiotherapy and have been injected with goserelin. Not yet taking tamoxifen though. lou x

Posts.Title: I don't know what to do

Posts.Content: thanks for letting me join this group. During August 2016 I was diagnosed with invasive breast cancer stage 2. I have since had a mastectomy of my left breast and many lymph nodes removed under my arm. Last Wednesday I went for a post op appt and was informed that after analysis of what they removed they identified stage 2 and stage 3 cells also that out of 18 lymph nodes 13 were positive!!! I then spoke to my breast care nurse who said that I was cancer free, meaning they had removed all known cancer. I then attended  an Oncologist appt last Friday and the news was a lot different. The lump was 15cm and attached to my chest wall and that all the cancer was not removed. I am a diabetic and chemo will  probably not be the best option for me. I am waiting for a PET scan. Oncologist said that it was highly likely that it had spread and that if they entered all my results into computer about life expectancy it would not make nice reading. I am in shock!!!! Two conflicking appts! I also felt unprepared for the oncologist appt. I feel let down by my breast care nurse. I cry, I'm scared and have t eaten properly since Thursday . I don't know what to do
Posts.Title: I don't know what to do

Posts.Content: i sent too quickly - I wanted to wish you all the best with your up coming appts and would love to know how you get on if you are up to it. louise x

Posts.Content: Apologies if my profile was badly written. I am rushing to do everything whereas normally I take time, this has been a tremendous shock and can't seem to pick myself up. Thank you for your message. x
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapies, Mood and Memory.....

Posts.Content: Thank you June. It really helps to talk to someone who has been through treatment in a similar way. I am trying to come to terms with my diagnosis - mine started as invasive stage 2 and is now stage 3 and aggressive. I had a CT scan about 6 weeks ago which was all clear. I am now having a PET scan as at a high risk it could have gone somewhere else. So worried! I was ER+ and an 8 score and am being told that hormone therpay will work well on me whereas chemo probably won't. This scared me but reading a few stories where ladies have not had chemo I am starting to wonder why I am worried! I had a mastectomy with some invasion into chest muscle and nodes removed so having rads for this. Well done for taking the drugs you are not alone louise x
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapies, Mood and Memory.....

Posts.Content: I am very new to this sight and have been given some great help. I had a zolodex injection last Friday to shut off ovaries from producing oestrogen as I am stag 3 ER AND PR +. it may be that I will not have chemo so instead they are talking about tamoxifen to start with and then when that stops working there is a ladder of further hormone treatments. is there anyone else in the same situation. There is a high possibility I will never been cured from BC but BCN said that patients can take only hormone treatment for years - is this correct, is there anyone who is at doing only hormone treatment? I am very scared to say the least and just cant pick myself up.
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapies, Mood and Memory.....

Posts.Content: Thank you for your message and help Carolyn. I have update my profile.
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapies, Mood and Memory.....

Posts.Content: Hi June - thank you for the message. Could I ask why you did not have chemo? Also a little more about the type of breast cancer you have. No worries if not as it's a very personal question. My cancer was a very high osetrogen fuelled cancer so I have had ovaries switched off via zolodex. Not on tamoxifen yet as waiting for PET scan as I have a high risk it could have spread. They haven't ruled out chemo but it probably isn't going to be beneficial to me whereas hormone therapy will be. Why do you get bloating is this because of the osteoporosis? Take care Louise x
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapies, Mood and Memory.....

Posts.Content: I have had 1 cycle of AC chemo, 4 to follow, has anyone had their blood pressure rise due to chemo? My blood pressure is normally fine 120/80 but has increased to 150/70. Any info appreciated x
Posts.Title: Blood Pressure

Posts.Content: Thanks R, I feel extremely anxious and nervous currently. I had a nurses appt yesterday and she took it 3 times and each time 147/80 she didn't do anything just said get it checked again at my next nurses appt next Friday - probably all due to the bloomin amount of appts and not sure what to expect. Thanks for your time BW Louise x
Posts.Title: Blood Pressure

Posts.Content: Haha that did make me laugh Lynn but I shouldn't really laugh at his expensive. Good on him for getting back to an exercise/diet regime! Also thanks for top tips re BP, as per your advice I have set up an excel spreadsheet to record temp, BP and heart beat. Bought the machine thingy today. Tested myself 20 times already lol only joking about 4. 132/80 so has come down a bit. Nurse in Boots said to me it's the lower figure that's important ?? Enjoy your evening xx
Posts.Title: Blood Pressure

Posts.Content: Hi Susanneg thanks for responding, not surprising getting a high reading prior to op I dread to think what mine was. Hospitals, doctors, consultant appts all contribute to a high reading x
Posts.Title: Blood Pressure

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn. Thank you for the advice. I have a dog and take him for a walk or to the park daily. I am also drinking 2 litres of water daily. I do have an iPhone so will look for your suggested app ta very muchly. I have had one cycle of chemo next one next week and this morning when I brushed my hair it is coming out increasingly. This has only just started, bit of a b*tch but predictable. No wonder my BP is high!! BW Lou x
Posts.Title: Blood Pressure

Posts.Content: Thanks Joallen I appreciate you taking the time to respond. I feel very anxious this week, probably due to next chemo cycle approaching. I have a nurse appt for a zolodex implant next Friday and will get her to check it then. Louise x
Posts.Title: Blood Pressure

Posts.Content: Thanks Julia. I feel anxious most of the time which isn't helping, I have downloaded a couple of apps mindfulness and guided mind to help relax me if that's possible BW xx
Posts.Title: Blood Pressure

Posts.Content: King Charles spaniel. I can't even touch my hair in case further comes out and thinking of shaving it off I can't face. I have purchased a wig for when this happens but at the back of my mind hoping this will not be used. I guess its inevitable but you must have been very brave. Xx
Posts.Title: Blood Pressure

Posts.Content: Thanks for replying Lynn. I will buy a BP machine over the weekend. I think I have turned into a hypochondriac haha BW x

Posts.Content: Hi Flopsyuk - thank you for the link. I had a heart echo prior to chemo and all was good, I am going to mention to my oncologist next Tuesday at an appt and see what he suggests. Let's hope it's just me being anxious BW xx
Posts.Title: Blood Pressure

Posts.Content: Thanks Lynn. This morning it was 133/76, I have started to record the data and see if there is a trend. Nice to talk with you x
Posts.Title: Blood Pressure

Posts.Content: Hi Crystaljuju,  thank you for the post, would you be able to explain why hormone therapy is enough without chemo?!? I am ER+ 8/8 but also had chemo? I could be reading it wrong but it's interesting, many thanks Lou x
Posts.Title: Anybody heard or used the Oncotype Dx test for deciding treatment...

Posts.Content: Hi Julia - this one and thanks xx Hi EJM60  The score of the oestrogen is a big factor. Anne's er score  was mid range which meant she might not get the full benefit of hormonal therapies Which is the reason chemo was recommended. The higher your score the more benefit you get from hormonal therapies i.e. They work better. Your ER score would have been out of 8. hormonal therapies with a high score would have been enough without chemo. I know it's easy for us to compare diagnosis but there is so much to consider.  Love Julia x
Posts.Title: Anybody heard or used the Oncotype Dx test for deciding treatment...

Posts.Content: Thanks for helping Julia. I did not have the oncotype test. My BC had lymph nodes involved and was classed as a grade 3, maybe this is why I had chemo. I have no spread anywhere else and had a mastectomy. Like you say I read things on here without having the whole picture maybe. We are all swamped with information. Love lou x
Posts.Title: Anybody heard or used the Oncotype Dx test for deciding treatment...

Posts.Content: Hi JMC04 I am stage 3 invasive BC, I had a mastectomy on 12.9.16, I had a PET CT scan which thankfully was clear and started AC chemo on 27th Oct. when I was diagnosed I put up a barrier around me and my family and didn't want to have anyone intruding but over the last month I have lowered the barrier and friends/family have been amazing! I am sleeping better but was there like you worrying at 3am. In the short term you will feel like you have taken a step back but with mastectomy and possible treatment ahead you are building for the future. Always here if needed special wishes xx
Posts.Title: The long wait.

Posts.Content: Hi Had Enough - I became breathless and tired during chemo and when they checked my bloods I had become anemic. This happened at my very last chemo session, they went ahead with the chemo but offered me a blood transfusion which I took. 6 weeks after chemo I asked for my bloods to be checked again and I was still anemic so had another transfusion last Saturday. Hopefully that will be it and bloods back to normal. I'm having a blood test in a couple of weeks to see. Hope you feel better soon xx
Posts.Title: Breathlessness

Posts.Content: Hope you are ok LL. Sometimes it's all just too much. You are on zoladex which I thinks doesn't help with emotions. To be positive it's good to let it out or get it off your chest. Much love and hugs Lou x ps loving the pictures
Posts.Title: Feelings.......

Posts.Content: Hi- what a good read! Made me chuckle and all so spot on! I stuffer with many of these issues too. Thank you ladies as it's really positive to laugh about it! There is nothing out there you can buy or be prescribed to knock the side effects on the head - so looking forward to having my zoladex on Monday afternoon haha!! I wish everyone a sweat free weekend xxx
Posts.Title: NOT Pink and Fluffy! RETURNS....

Posts.Content: Hi Spicedtea could I ask how long you have been off work? I have been off since sept 16. I am signed off until end of Feb. I am not sure I want to go back, I have lovely work colleagues and have been in the post for 10years. I like the job. Every time I think about work all that comes to mind is 'this is where I was diagnosed' and I sometimes think I would like to forget this whole experience which means how could I return??? X
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Thanks for taking the time to reply Nicky. I sell to the NHS, I work in an office so have a desk job. It did cross my mind that I may have been thinking about a return too early as I am just about to start the radiotherapy process. The Next Steps seminar sounds such a great idea, I am going to see if there is anything like this near to where I live - thanks. It's a hard decision the life we had has changed, forever. I now realise what is important and work currently isn't one of them. My family, myself my dog are a top priority now!!
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Hi spicedtea what breed of dog do you have? Mine is a King Charles spaniel. I love him to bits and like you love taking him to the park with ballie!! :-) Lou x
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Barfy - I would advise taking a shirt type nightie as the nurse will probably need to keep checking the surgery. You can then easily just unbutton, If you had a t-shirt type one you may not be able to lift over your head to get it off, if you get my drift. I had a mastectomy to left boob and lymph node clearance. I have a fear of anaesthetics and even I got through it. Will be thinking of you Lou x
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!
